duties_responsibilities.duty: Identifying systemic opportunities and problems, initiating innovative solutions to support the vision.
Interacting with Customer Service and Shipping/Receiving locations to understand production forecast and support rail transportation needs.
Monitoring transit times, working with railroads to expedite equipment movement.
Analyzing and reporting rail accessorial charges with the objective to eliminate wherever possible.
Focusing on fleet optimization and driving economic value.
Auditing vendor invoices for freight, maintenance, storage, detention, railcar lease costs.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain (Master's preferred)
Experience with and working knowledge of Rail industry; Class I and shortline railroads
